intro: Cistus × curvativus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock rose, is a hybrid shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional herbal medicine.
